story.title: When the Stars Align - Episode 1
story.storyDescription: Ed: Dude, I made it to the front of the stage! Where are you?
story.creator: web-uploader

author.bio: Chris Marie Green writes hot contemporary romance (like “Bedroomies”!) plus urban fantasy. She also loves devouring pop culture and avoiding international incidents while traveling.

messages.text: Dude, I made it to the front of the stage! Where are you?
Just walked in. I don’t see you…
Push your way through the crowd. I’m sure you’ll find me. Hurry up!
Okay, on my way...
Someone rams into Jason, almost sending his phone flying out of his hand.
He looks down and sees a girl with a pixie haircut and big brown eyes.
His world tilts on its axis.
Starr??
Jason??
It’s been three years since his high school girlfriend moved overseas...
Three long years since she suddenly and inexplicably ended things over email.
So why is she looking at him like he still holds her heart in his hands?
You’re back from Japan?
Yeah. I got here last weekend.
I’m eighteen now, so I came back here without Dad.
At the mention of her father, an awkward pause weights the air.
Jason tries to lighten things up…
Even though his chest is aching from the very sight of Starr.
Is your father still as charming as ever?
Starr laughs.
Charming isn’t exactly the word I’d use.
We definitely agree on that.
I get that he was just being protective…
But I’ll never forget those angry looks he’d give me when I’d walk you home from school.
And that was nothing compared to the night I showed up to take you on our first date.
I’m still sorry about how he treated you, Jason.
No worries. It was always worth it, sneaking around with you.
The crowd pushes Starr against Jason’s side.
At the contact, the ache inside his chest tightens.
Listen, Jason…my dad…
I couldn’t live under his thumb anymore.
That’s why I decided to move back here.
She pauses, looking up into his eyes.
Alone.
The crowd suddenly surges, sweeping Starr away with it.
Jason’s heart jolts—
He reaches over the people who are separating him from Starr.
And…there!
He grasps her hand to keep her with him.
An electricity surges through him.
Starr’s gaze softens as she looks at him as if no time has passed at all...
As if they’re still the same boy and girl who said they would always love each other.
They’re inches away now, breathing in the same air between them.
I…I never expected to see you again…
That letter you sent me after I left absolutely tore me apart.
What letter?
Remember? The one about how we were too young to spend our lives pining for each other?
You said we needed to make a clean break.
Jason frowns, because that’s what Starr wrote in HER breakup email to HIM.
Then something dawns on him.
Is it possible her dad wrote those messages?
But before he can ask, the crowd swells again...
And Starr’s hand is wrenched out of Jason’s grasp.
The crowd wedges them apart.
She desperately shouts as she’s swept away.
If you ever want to explain why you dumped me, my number is—
The crowd has gotten louder and crazier.
Jason hears her say 321-7655 before she gets lost in the masses.
He shoots her a text. He holds his breath as it sends...
But the message doesn’t go through.
Crap! Did he mishear the number?
For the rest of the night, he madly searches for her in the arena.
No luck.
Starr has been ripped out of his life yet again.
One day later.
Jason sits in a coffeehouse, staring out a window when Ed texts him.
Have you given up looking for Starr yet?
NO.
Jason, you’ve searched everywhere for her.
Do you think she’s even looking for you?
I told you —she still thinks I’m the one who dumped her!
Well, I still say let it go.
I mean, come on, what kind of person isn’t on social media?
Are you sure you want to date someone like that?
You know her dad didn’t let her have an account.
I thought her whole reason for moving here was to get away from her dad?
So maybe she’s private. Maybe she changed her settings so I couldn’t find her.
And now she’s probably upset because I didn’t call.
You tried, man. What else were you supposed to do?
I think you should just face it...
This situation doesn’t look hopeful.
I don’t care what the odds are.
Last night I got a second chance with the girl who’s meant for me.
If I’d known the full story about the emails when I was fifteen…
I would’ve crossed an ocean to find her.
Now we’re both here. I’m obviously going to look for her.
Whatever, man. It’s your time you’re wasting.
Have you ever heard that saying about stars aligning?
That’s what’s happening now.
This is my chance.
You’re just setting yourself up for disappointment.
I’m not giving up.
And, as the days pass, Jason doesn’t.
He looks for Starr everywhere in the city...
But it’s as if she’s disappeared into thin air.
Three days later.
Jason sees someone who looks like Starr walk by him—
But on the other side of the street.
Before he calls out to her, she goes into the subway entrance.
Jason can’t help it. He follows the woman through the turnstiles—
And watches her rush for a train.
She gets on at the last minute.
Jason sprints after her and she looks up.
It’s her.
STARR!!
As the subway doors start closing, Jason makes a break for it.
But they shut in his face.
Starr presses her hand against the window.
Jason’s stomach sinks.
It’s as if Starr’s father is still between them, wedging them apart...
But, just as things are at their most hopeless…
Starr starts rummaging through her bag.
The fear of rejection is written all over her face.
She pulls out a sketchpad and then holds it up.
You didn’t call.
He tries to shout through the doors.
I HAD THE WRONG NUMBER!
She shakes her head and writes another note.
Jason fumbles as he connects to wifi, and then texts her.
Dammit, the concert was too loud. I was ONE digit off.
There’s something you have to know.
I never wrote you a breakup letter...
And I’m pretty sure you didn’t write the breakup email I got.
What? You got a breakup email from me?
The train lurches.
Starr’s fingers fly over her cell phone.
Meet me at the next stop!
So Jason runs, as fast as he can.
When he gets to the platform, Starr is standing there.
Understanding has settled over her face.
My dad wrote those messages.
It seems so.
He obviously did everything he could to break us up...
He even gave me a new phone once we moved. That’s why you didn’t have my number.
My God, Jason...
As their gazes connect, it’s as if there’s a chain of pulsing white heat between them.
I walked around with a broken heart for years.
Me, too.
You know what’s funny?
I was getting on the train because I left something at home.
We almost missed each other.
Jason takes her hands and there’s a jolt between them—
The feeling of their hearts pulsing, reaching out for one another.
Just as surely as they did three years ago.
As the crowd jostles them, he squeezes her tightly, determined to never let go.
I’m NOT going to lose you again.
Promise?
Even if something comes between us?
The crowd swells around them.
Promise.
And as they fall into each other’s arms for an explosive kiss…
The stars align.
Everything clicks back to into place.
Just like it always should have been.
